file_content.text: Safe in the arms of the Republic.
[This cell has been unlocked.]
Malcom Terrax? The Republic's offering you a pardon. In exchange for information.
The cavalry's come, has it? But maybe I don't like your terms.
That's kind of you, Jedi, but I'm not that easy.
I think you're a little mixed up, soldier. You and I are enemies.
Is that so? I hope you've got more up your sleeve than a blaster.
The things I know are worth more than my life. What makes you think I'll share any of them with you?
I'm the only thing standing between you and a firing squad.
Because you want to live.
It's not that simple. Imperial traitors are death-marked for the rest of their lives.
Being executed for doing my job might make me a little angry.
Revenge on the Empire.
We're trained to think of it as our final duty.
I'll kill you otherwise.
You have no idea which one is worse, do you?
I help you, I forfeit my nice, quick shot to the head. The Empire will hunt me down and make me pay.
So for the Republic to give me a fighting chance, I'll need credits, supplies and transport offworld.
You're in no position to make demands.
That's bold of you.
And you're in no position to turn them down.
Perhaps I'll leave you here instead.
Don't test my patience.
We both know you won't.
My job is to get you out safe.
I can't promise that.
Do it, then. I'll hope for better things on the way.
I'd ask for the same myself.
I'll back you up.
Then you're smarter than you look.
Whatever you want.
You better come through.
We'll just have to trust each other, won't we?
We should get moving. Dusk Squadron regroups quickly. Whenever you're ready, I'll follow.
Hurry. Dusk Squadron doesn't look for escapees--they hunt them down.
[This cell is empty.]
